content:
• Thursday, December 15, 2016
  • AGIO

    Agios Pharma -19% after halting development of anemia drug

    • Agios Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:AGIO) -19.1% AH after saying it is discontinuing development of an experimental drug to treat a rare form of anemia due to side effects seen in a study.
    • AGIO says it withdrew its investigational new drug application for its AG-519 treatment for pyruvate kinase deficiency, an inherited condition where gene mutations from each parent cause an accelerated destruction of red blood cells, after the FDA put a clinical study of the drug on hold.
    • The drugmaker says the decision does not affect the development of another drug candidate, AG-348, for the condition.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 PM | 5 Comments
  • CBB

    Cincinnati Bell prices upsize to offering of 7% notes

    • Cincinnati Bell (CBB +2.3%) has priced an additional $200M in debt under an issuance the company launched in September.
    • The company's upsized its offering of 7% senior notes due 2024, priced at 105% of principal plus accrued interest from Sept. 22.
    • Earlier, the company said it would offer an additional $150M of the notes under an indenture from September, when the company issued $425M principal of the notes.
    • The notes will be treated as a single series and the offering is expected to close Dec. 23. Cincinnati Bell will use net proceeds to repay some $208M of indebtedness under a senior secured term loan facility.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:01 PM
  • GILD

    Merck wins $2.5B patent verdict against Gilead

    • Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD) -1.7% AH after a federal jury orders the company to pay $2.5B in damages to Merck (NYSE:MRK) in a case over alleged patent infringement in development of hepatitis C drugs.
    • The judge in the case already had determined that MRK’s patent was infringed by GILD’s Sovaldi and Harvoni drugs, which account for more than half the latter company’s revenue, and the jury said GILD owed 10% royalties on $25.4B in total sales for the two drugs.
    • The patent infringement decision is the largest in U.S. history and could grow even larger, as the judge could increase the damage award by as much as 3x the amount set by the jury.
    • GILD, which says it will appeal the decision, says the verdict does not affect its ability to sell its products.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM | 194 Comments
  • NTDOY

    Nintendo -3.3% as 'Super Mario Run' rolls out; success priced in?

    • Nintendo (OTCPK:NTDOY) shares traded 3.3% lower in U.S. trading on the day of its release of Super Mario Run to Apple devices -- the company's long-awaited full move into mobile gaming -- as many observers saw the positives from the game already baked into the stock price.
    • The game should make up anywhere from $300M-$500M in revenue, depending on analyst estimates. Jefferies' Atul Goyal is on the positive side, but Goyal notes consensus estimates have come down despite the positive catalyst.
    • "Not only does SMR contribute to higher profits this year (via iOS) and next year (via Android), the weaker JPY is also an incremental positive," Goyal said. "That should have been enough for sell-side estimates to rise significantly from a low base. But that is not the case. We believe that sell-side has not yet factored in the potential revenues and profits and is waiting to see how the game actually performs."
    • Nintendo's also taking a risk by departing from the pure "free-to-play" model that dominates mobile game successes, and charging $9.99 for the game (the first three of 24 levels are available as a free taste).
    • The company's biggest challenge in its new arena of smartphone gaming may be Pokemon Go -- a smash hit that benefited Nintendo, but not as much as Mario might since Pokemon was led by partner Niantic. While Super Mario Run depends on beloved characters and a simple control scheme, it lacks the viral and social strengths featured in Pokemon Go -- and is a paid game to boot.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 34 Comments
  • JBL

    Jabil Circuit +11%, Q1 over forecasts

    • Results – revenue $5.1B (-2.1% Y/Y, $190M above estimates), EPS $0.69 ($0.05 above estimates), operating income $209.5M
    • Q2 projections – revenue $4.2B-$4.5B (consensus $4.36B), EPS $0.35-$0.57 (consensus $0.46), operating income $125M-$165M, Diversified Manufacturing Services revenue -2% Y/Y, Electronics Manufacturing Services revenue consistent Y/Y
    • Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL) CEO Mark Mondello: "I’m really pleased with our strong first quarter results. In particular, we saw strength in our healthcare, packaging and consumer lifestyles businesses within our DMS segment, combined with yet another solid quarter of execution from our EMS segment, allowing us to deliver excellent results. Looking ahead, we’ll remain focused on our multi-year financial objectives and longer-term enterprise goals, while following through on our commitment to return capital to shareholders, as previously communicated under our two-year capital allocation framework."
    • Earnings call slides
    • Conference call
    • 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM

  • ORCL

    Oracle -1.75%; Q2 print overall okay, SaaS, PaaS revenue up 81%

    • Results – revenue $9.07B (+0.8% Y/Y, $50M below estimates), EPS $0.61 ($0.01 above estimates), operating income $3.8B, operating margin 42%, net income $2.6B, short-term deferred revenue $7.4B (+6% Y/Y), operating cash flow on trailing twelve-month basis $14.2B (+9% Y/Y)
    • Segment revenues – Cloud software as a service and platform as a service $878M (+81% Y/Y), Cloud infrastructure as a service $175M (+6% Y/Y), Total cloud $1.053B (+62% Y/Y), New software licenses $1.347B (-20% Y/Y), Software license updates and product support $4.777B (+2% Y/Y), Total on-premise software $6.124B (-4% Y/Y), Total cloud and on-premise software $7.177B (+2% Y/Y), Hardware products $497M (-13% Y/Y), Hardware support $517M (-6% Y/Y), Total hardware $1.014B (-10% Y/Y), Total services $844M (-2% Y/Y)
    • Oracle chairman (NYSE:ORCL) and CTO Larry Ellison and co-CEOs Mark Hurd and Safra Catz each single out Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) in their respective quarterly report commentaries, strongly emphasizing Oracle's SaaS and PaaS growth rates relative to the competitor.
    • Conference call
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 14 Comments
  • FNSR

    Finisar proposes $450M convertible senior note offering

    • In private placement and due in 2036. Initial purchaser to be granted 30-day option to purchase $67.5M aggregate principal amount to cover over-allotments.
    • Notes are to be unsecured and unsubordinated obligations of the company, with interest payable twice a year in arrears on June 15 and December 15, beginning in 2017.
    • Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR) shares -4.65% after hours.
    • Full release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 5 Comments
  • ADBE

    Adobe Systems beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Adobe Systems (NASDAQ:ADBE): FQ4 EPS of $0.90 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $1.61B (+22.9% Y/Y) beats by $20M.
    • Shares +2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 12 Comments
  • BAC

    Bank of America bullish at Raymond James even after post-election run-up

    • Bank of America (BAC +2.2%) is upgraded to Outperform from Market Perform at Raymond James, even after the stock has gained 36% since election day thanks to higher interest rates and the hope that the Trump victory will create a less onerous regulatory environment for bank stocks.
    • Why now? The firm says it views BofA as a general proxy for the health of the U.S. economy, and it "sees better days ahead" with the prospect of stronger economic growth and expected changes brought by the new administration.
    • James also sees an outsized benefit for BofA relative to smaller banks from the potential for reduced regulatory burden, a reduction in corporate tax rates, and higher capital return.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 22 Comments
  • KNX

    Swift Transportation +4% after J.P. Morgan upgrade

    • Swift Transportation (SWFT +3.8%) is upgraded to Overweight from Neutral with a $31 price target, raised from $23, at J.P. Morgan, which says the shares offer the most attractive risk/reward in the transportation and logistics group.
    • The firm sees realized rates turning positive in 2017 from reduced capacity, with further gains in realized rates in 2018, and improved demand amid a turn in the truckload cycle.
    • The upgrade follows yesterday's note from Deutsche Bank saying U.S. transportation stocks should get a boost in 2017 by stronger GDP growth and a reduction in the corporate tax.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • YY

    Deutsche Bank prefers YY to Momo in coverage launch

    • Deutsche Bank has a pair trade of sorts on Chinese video/app platforms as it initiates coverage of YY at Buy, while starting Momo (NASDAQ:MOMO) at Hold.
    • YY gets strong marks from its viewers and performers in several metrics, Deutsche Bank's survey notes, and it's more popular than Momo among live video viewers. “User trend disruption remains the short-term risk (for YY), while we believe YY’s current business model will underpin its long-term success,” writes Eileen Deng.
    • Momo, meanwhile, faces later advertising monetization given its heavy focus on live broadcasting at the moment. Deng expects mobile marketing revenue to grow at 32% compounded annually in 2017-2019.
    • In September, Credit Suisse launched coverage of both companies at Buy.
    • Both stocks are lower today in U.S. trading: YY -2.8%; MOMO -6.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 6 Comments

  • First Internet Bancorp announces pricing of common stock

    • First Internet Bancorp (INBK+5.6%) priced underwritten offering of 945K shares at a price of $26.50/share for net proceeds of approx. $23.4M.
    • The offering is expected to close on or about December 20, 2016.
    • Sole book-runner: Keefe, Bruyette & Woods; Co-Manager: FIG Partners.
    • Net proceeds to be used for general corporate purposes, repayment of indebtedness, financing investments and capital expenditures, and for investments in the Bank as regulatory capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM

  • Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:10 PM

  • EPD

    Enterprise Products Partners restarts Pascagoula gas plant

    • Enterprise Products Partners (EPD +1.7%) has restarted its 1.5B cf/day Pascagoula natural gas processing plant in Mississippi following a six-month shutdown to repair damage resulting from a June fire.
    • Federal investigators say the event was limited to only one of the Pascagoula plant’s three cryogenic processing trains, although the probe into the cause of June 27 explosion and subsequent fire remains ongoing.
    • At the time of the incident, the plant was averaging ~400M cf/day of inlet-gas volumes.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 8 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:30 pm

    • Gainers: WATT +6%. SWM +6%. OTC:FENX +5%. NTZ +5%.
    • Losers: WILC -8%. NVFY -7%. KNDI -7%. RELV -6%. PVH -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • WFC

    Fed adopts bailout prevention rule, forcing big banks to issue more debt

    • The Fed votes to adopt a bailout prevention rule that will force big banks to issue substantial amounts of new long-term debt, largely upholding a draft issued early this year.
    • Half of the eight largest U.S. banks would need to issue ~$70B in fresh debt or equity to satisfy the new Total Loss Absorbing Capacity standard, the Fed estimates.
    • In all, the Fed says U.S. banks’ funding costs would increase by $680M-$2B annually, higher than the upper estimate of $1.5B in its October 2015 proposal.
    • Fed officials do not identify the four banks that lack sufficient debt; Wells Fargo (WFC +1.6%) said in November it envisioned issuing at least an additional $29B in debt to satisfy the rule.
    • Besides WFC, the banks expected to satisfy the new rule are JPMorgan Chase (JPM +1.9%), Bank of America (BAC +2.6%), Citigroup (C +1.6%), State Street (STT +1.1%), BNY Mellon (BK +1.4%), Morgan Stanley (MS +0.9%) and Goldman Sachs (GS +1.7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 77 Comments

    • Losers: OTC:FNBC -6%. MITT -6%. INTL -6%. ACRE -5%. SFNC -5%.

  • PHIO

    RXi Pharma readies equity offering

    • RXi Pharmaceuticals (RXII +18.3%) has filed an S-1 with the SEC in preparation for a public offering of 1,348,300 Class A Units and 9,600 Class B Units.
    • Each Class A Unit consists of one share of common stock and one warrant to purchase one share of common.
    • Each Class B Units consists of warrants to purchase 561 common shares and one share of Series B Convertible Preferred Stock convertible into 561 common shares.
    • The offering will proceed after the SEC declares the filing effective.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM
  • BDC

    Deutsche Bank initiates Belden at Buy

    • Setting an accompanying $85 price target (current price $78.35).
    • Analyst Sherri Scribner, noting growing interconnectivity across the globe, spotlights Belden's (NYSE:BDC) key positioning within broadband infrastructure, enterprise connectivity and industrial markets. Observes tailwinds involving higher-quality video consumption, rising numbers of broadband subscribers and proliferation of connected infrastructure (buildings, factories) and devices (IoT).
    • Shares are higher by 2% on the day to $78.18.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • BIDU

    Brean Capital restates $196 target on Baidu

    • Following investor calls with management, analyst Fawne Jiang notes Baidu expects the customer verification process across all categories to finalize by year end, core search growth to recover as a result, and for overall sentiment to improve heading into the new year on a better-quality base of customers and refocusing on operations and new customer acquisition.
    • Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) shares have fallen 1.4% on the session to $167.40 despite the reissued Buy-rating commentary.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • HEINY

    Heineken to be a big player in U.K. pub scene

    • Heineken (OTCQX:HEINY, OTCQX:HKHHF, OTCQX:HINKF, OTCQX:HKHHY) beat out two other bidders to acquire Punch Taverns. The deal values the U.K. pub operator at $502M.
    • The Dutch beer gaint will now be the third largest pub operator in the U.K. The Punch pubs will be intergrated into the existing Star Pubs & Bars pub business six months after the deal closes.
    • Punch Taverns (OTC:PCTVF, OTCPK:PCTVD) rose 8.2% in London to top off a +50% week amid all the interest.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • AMD

    Morgan Stanley upgrades Advanced Micro Devices to Equal Weight

    • Raising target accordingly from $5 to $11 (current price $10.86).
    • Analyst Joseph Moore, while noting his firm's prior observation of potential for Advanced Micro Devices' (AMD +3.3%) Zen opportunity, remains surprised shares have rallied to current levels given respective $0.04 and $0.26 consensus EPS projections for the next two years. (current year consensus -$0.15). Further notes major product cycle achievements have been realized at the company in the past, but it has struggled to maintain them.
    • Ultimately considers opportunity short-lived on anticipated shipment of 10nm offerings from Intel, though nonetheless projects significant upside to expectations (models $0.31 EPS vs. $0.04 FY 2017 consensus) on positive milestones for Zen and a reversal contradictory to consensus view he doesn't consider likely.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 70 Comments
  • HOV

    Homebuilders on the move as confidence surges to 11-year high

    • Homebuilder stocks enjoy healthy gains after the NAHB sentiment index rose to its highest level since July 2005, with its six-month sales outlook also jumping to an 11-year high.
    • Despite rising mortgage rates, the post-election bounce in builder sentiment is consistent with other data showing U.S. industries are optimistic that Pres.-elect Trump will make it easier for companies to do business.
    • In today's trade: HOV +3.8%, KBH +2.5%, BZH +2.3%, TOL +2.1%, MDC +2.1%, PHM +1.4%, DHI +1.4%, LEN +1.2%.
    • ETFs: XHB, ITB
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 7 Comments
  • AABA

    Yahoo -4.9% on reports Verizon considers scrapping deal

    • Yahoo (YHOO) has dropped in recent minutes, now down 4.9%, on word that Verizon (NYSE:VZ) is now considering scrapping its $4.83B deal for the Internet pioneer.
    • Yahoo yesterday disclosed a security breach that it believes compromised information on more than a billion user accounts. That breach is thought to be separate from a previously disclosed incursion affecting half a billion accounts, and reports that Yahoo scanned thousands of customers' e-mails on behalf of government intelligence services.
    • Verizon may yet seek a price cut; after fall reports of the first reported hack, parties at Verizon indicated the deal still made sense.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM | 71 Comments
  • XLNX

    Xilinx upgraded to Overweight at Morgan Stanley

    • From Equal Weight prior, analyst Joseph Moore notes positives for Xilinx on continued evolution of machine learning and an inference market transition from microprocessors to specialty solutions (FPGAs, graphics, other chips), momentum relative to Intel/Altera in the two latest manufacturing nodes, and general overall growth improvement in FPGAs on automotive, factory and data center penetration.
    • Considers Xilinx (XLNX +5.3%) to be emerging as leader within inference and raises target accordingly from $46 to $67 (current price $59.68).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

  • PRU

    Prudential OKs $1.25B stock buyback, sees 2017 EPS $10.15-$10.65

    • Prudential (PRU +2.5%) pops higher after disclosing authorization to repurchase up to $1.25B of outstanding shares during 2017.
    • Providing guidance ahead of today's financial outlook call, PRU also says it expects FY 2017 EPS of $10.15-$10.65, vs. $10.34 analyst consensus estimate, despite headwinds from interest rates and currencies.
    • PRU says its near-to-immediate term return on equity objective is 12%-13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 4 Comments
  • BHC

    Morgan Stanley softens view on Valeant, cuts price target to $17; Ackman backs away; shares slump 7%

    • Morgan Stanley downgrades Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX -7.1%) to Equal Weight from Overweight and drops the price target to $17 (29% upside) from $25.
    • Wells Fargo reiterates its Underperform rating.
    • Long-time bull Bill Ackman recently cut his stake in the company.
    • Read now Bill Ackman Preempts Yellen By Cutting Valeant Exposure
     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 97 Comments

  • Natural gas futures rise after sharp inventory decline

    • EIA Natural Gas Inventory: -147 Bcf vs. -128 Bcf consensus -42 Bcf last week.
    • Futures +1.1% to $3.576.
    • ETFs: UNG, DGAZ, UGAZ, BOIL, GAZ, KOLD, UNL, DCNG

  • ZTS

    Cowen upgrades Zoetis, sees 14% upside

    • Cowen & Company upgrades Zoetis (ZTS +3.4%) to Outperform from Market Perform and raises the price target to $60 (14% upside) from $50.
    • Four other shops that recently updated coverage rate the stock a Buy with price targets ranging from $58 - 63.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • MLCO

    Melco Crown lower after Crown Resorts unloads large share block

    • Shares of Melco Crown (MPEL) slide 6.96% to $16.10 after Crown Resorts announces it's dumping a large block.
    • The offering price of the 40.97M share offering is reported by Bloomberg to be $16.35.
    • Bernstein Research on the MPEL development: "We view this transaction as positive as it shows strong commitment from Chairman Lawrence Ho. The purchase removes some overhang from a sale by Crown of MPEL shares. However, Crown will still own 14% of MPEL after this transaction. The controlling shareholder is showing strong commitment to MPEL and Crown is slowly and orderly reducing its stake."
    • Previously: Melco International acquires larger stake in Melco Crown (Dec. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM | 6 Comments
  • ONVO

    BTIG likes Organovo, sees 28% upside; shares ahead 5%

    • BTIG Research initiates coverage on Organovo (ONVO +5.1%) with a Buy rating and $5 (28% upside) price target.
    • Analyst Sean Lavin says the company is a long-term investment with "multiple opportunities" and claims that the global preclinical testing market for liver and kidney tissue is $3.7B.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 11 Comments
  • SAFM

    Chicken producers lower after soft outlook from Sanderson Farms

    • Sanderson Farms (SAFM -4%) warns on export demand as it looks ahead to next year.
    • The ban in China related to avian influenza and continued backlash from low oil prices and a strong U.S. dollar are impacting prices on larger-sized birds, says management.
    • The chicken pricing pressure is more than enough to offset volume gains.
    • Shares of Sanderson Farms have retreated dramatically from their post-earnings rush, while the soft outlook has also sent Tyson Foods (TSN -0.8%) and Pilgrim's Pride (PPC -2.5%) lower.
    • Previously: Sanderson Farms beats by $0.70, revenue in-line (Dec. 15)
    • Previously: Sanderson Farms spikes after earnings beat (Dec. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • NUE

    Nucor -2% following downbeat Q4 earnings outlook

    • Nucor (NUE -2.1%) opens lower after issuing downside Q4 guidance due to lower margins in its steel mills segment.
    • NUE now expects Q4 EPS of $0.30-$0.35, vs. $0.51 analyst consensus estimate; the company's forecast includes an estimated last-in-first-out expense of $0.07.
    • NUE also says trade cases initiated by U.S. steel industry targeting product groups are having a positive impact, as steel imports are down ~19% this year.
    • Other steel producers also are lower: X -2.6%, STLD -2.4%, AKS -2.8%, MT -3.4%, CMC -0.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • HIMX

    Himax Technologies downgraded to Neutral at Rosenblatt Securities

    • While analyst Jun Zhang notes Himax Technologies (NASDAQ:HIMX) remains the key player in the augmented and virtual reality market, lowers rating from Buy, citing anticipation for impact to large-size panel driver IC shipments on slower 4K adoption growth rate in 2017, an advance in the augmented and virtual market he doesn't anticipate to materialize until beyond 2018 (does highlight potential for TDDI in H2 2017), impact of India's low-end smartphone market in coming quarters, flat year-over-year smartphone market growth in China and a core business he considers lacking in catalysts.
    • Moves target from $9 to $7, above the $6.18 price shares are trading at this morning on 4.35% session losses.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 45 Comments
  • HLT

    BAML lifts hotel stocks

    • Bank of America Merrill Lynch is giving a boost to the hotel sector on an improved view of cyclical trends.
    • The investment firm pushes Hilton Worldwide (HLT +1.5%), Hyatt Hotels (H +1.1%), Extended Stay America (STAY +3.2%) to Buy from Neutral, while and La Quinta (LQ +3.6%) is bumped to Neutral from Underweight.
    • Analyst Shaun Kelley prefers playing the hotel sector with C-corps over REITs on its view tax reform and RevPar growth will drive upside.
    • Sources: Bloomberg and Marketbeat.com.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 2 Comments
  • SCHL

    Scholastic +3.5% after Q2 earnings beat

    • Scholastic (NASDAQ:SCHL) is up 3.5% premarket after beating profit expectations in its fiscal Q2 earnings report.
    • Revenues missed slightly despite growing 4%, to $623.1M, led by the trade channels in the U.S. and Canada (largely thanks to new Harry Potter-related publishing).
    • Operating profit from continuing operations grew 6% to $111.4M.
    • Net cash from operating activities was $179.7M vs. a year-ago $113.7M. Free cash flow of $164.1M vs. the prior $101.8M. Cash and equivalents exceeded debt by $435.6M.
    • It's affirmed its fiscal 2017 outlook for revenue of $1.7B-$1.8B (in line) and EPS from continuing operations of $1.60-$1.70 (vs. $1.68 consensus), along with free cash flow of $40M-$50M.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • PACB

    Pacific Bio down 28% premarket on Roche exit from development deal

    • Pacific Biosciences of California (NASDAQ:PACB) slumps 28% premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement that Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) has terminated the development, commercialization and license agreement with the company for the development and supply of diagnostic products based on its Single Molecule Real-Time (SMRT) technology. The contract, inked in 2013, allowed Roche to end the agreement for any reason with 60 days' notice.
    • Management will host a conference call today at 12:00 pm ET to discuss the situation.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 24 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:15 am

    • Gainers: BOSC +41%. ATHN +26%. PIR +21%. IDCC +18%. DCIX +11%. DRYS +13%. ARWR +6%.

  • ORIG

    Ocean Rig -32% following Q4 results

    • Ocean Rig UDW (NASDAQ:ORIG) -31.8% premarket after missing Q4 earnings and revenue estimates, and the company says it is continuing to explore strategic alternatives, including a possible restructuring under U.S. bankruptcy laws or another jurisdiction.
    • No bond buybacks were announced; Seeking Alpha's Vladimir Zernov writes that "the bond buyback theory is finally crushed, and it is clear that Ocean Rig will be negotiating with creditors rather than buying its bonds at a discount in an open market."
    • ORIG also says it is in discussions with ConocoPhillips about an early termination of the contract for the Ocean Rig Athena, which currently is sitting idle.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM | 55 Comments
  • HBI

    Hanesbrands sells Australian flooring and pillow businesses

    • Hanesbrands (NYSE:HBI) announced it sold its Australian Dunlop Flooring and Tontine pillow businesses to Victoria PLC for $25M.
    • The company says the businesses are noncore operations acquired as part of its purchase of Pacific Brands Limited of Australia.
    • The sales are expected to be completed in Q1 of 2017.
    • HBI +3.74% premarket to $23.30.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM | 5 Comments
  • PIR

    Guidance boost sends shares of Pier 1 flying

    • Pier 1 Imports (NYSE:PIR) skyrockets after a solid FQ3 earnings beat.
    • The retailer reports comparable sales growth of 1.80% for the quarter vs. -0.80% expected. Management says sales trends bounced back late in  November.
    • Looking ahead, Pier 1 expects FY17 EPS of $0.37-$0.41 vs. $0.24-$0.32 prior and $0.29 consensus.

  • AGNC

    Mortgage REIT fans mull big drop in BV at AGNC Investment

    • It's no surprise that AGNC's book value declined in November given the huge jump in interest rates that month, but the near-9% tumble in book since the end of Q3 was more than double the estimate of KBW's Bose George.
    • Maybe putting a bigger shudder through the rest of the sector, AGNC is among the better-hedged players, says George, and thus one of the companies better-positioned to withstand a rising rate environment.
    • Also on mREIT (BATS:REM) investors' minds was yesterday's Fed meeting - the Fed Funds rate was boosted as anticipated, but the median forecast for next year was lifted to three rate hikes vs. two previously.
    • BAML bails, downgrading AGNC to Underperform from Neutral. The $16 price target compares to yesterday's close of $17.89. Shares -1.9% premarket to $17.55.
    • Annaly Capital (NYSE:NLY) is also downgraded to Underperform at BAML, and is off 0.8% premarket (Annaly and pretty much all of the rest of the sector do not report book value on a monthly basis, so investors will wait in suspense until Q4 results next year).
    • Other ETFs: MORL, MORT
    • Previously: Big drop in book value for AGNC Investment (Dec. 14)

    • Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) releases is ifs financial outlook ahead of this morning's conference call.
    • 2016: Revenue: $20.8B - 21.2B (unch); EPS: $2.57 - 2.67 from $2.66 - 2.76; Non-GAAP EPS: $3.50 - 3.60 (unch).
    • 2017: Revenue: $21.8B - 22.3B; EPS: $3.51 - 3.61; Non-GAAP EPS: $4.05 - 4.15.
